transportAdvice: El Nido's main town is compact and walkable, though the surrounding islands and beaches require boat transfers. Tricycles are the primary local transport for short land trips, and multi-cab vans serve longer routes to other parts of Palawan, but coverage is limited and schedules can be irregular.

weather.description: Peak dry season with calm seas and sunny skies, making it the best time for island hopping.
Excellent beach weather continues with minimal rainfall and clear visibility for snorkeling.
Hot and dry with very little rain, ideal for outdoor activities and lagoon exploration.
One of the hottest months, still dry and great for water activities despite the heat.
Transition month as the wet season approaches, with occasional afternoon showers beginning.
Rainy season sets in with frequent downpours and rougher seas limiting boat tours.
Heavy rainfall and strong winds are common, and many island tours may be cancelled for safety.
Peak of the wet season with persistent rain and choppy waters; typhoon risk is elevated.
Continued heavy rain and rough seas make this one of the least favorable months to visit.
Rain begins to ease slightly but seas remain unpredictable and tours can still be disrupted.
Transition back toward the dry season with decreasing rainfall and improving sea conditions.
Dry season returns with pleasant temperatures and calmer waters, drawing holiday visitors.
